alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 9:29PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Pockets of freezing rain and and freezing drizzle possible between midnight and daybreak Wednesday morning... Rain will overspread the mid Hudson Valley and southern Taconics around or shortly after midnight, and continue into Wednesday morning. At the onset, surface temperatures will be near or slightly below freezing. Precipitation may begin as a brief mix of snow and sleet with a dusting possible, then quickly change to light sleet, rain and some isolated pockets of freezing rain. A trace to a light glaze could result in icy spots, especially any untreated surfaces including sidewalks, overpasses, bridges, exit and entrance ramps. Temperatures are expected to warm above freezing through the early morning hours.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess
